Class: ShapeController

ShapeController

ShapeController

Manipulates and displays the shape of objects on screen.

Constructor

new ShapeController(container, decompViewDict) → {ShapeController}

Parameters:
Name Type Description
container Node

Container node to create the controller in.
decompViewDict Object

This is object is keyed by unique identifiers and the values are DecompositionView objects referring to a set of objects presented on screen. This dictionary will usually be shared by all the tabs in the application. This argument is passed by reference.
Source:
  • shape-controller.js, line 28
Returns:

An instance of ShapeController

Type
ShapeController

  • EmperorAttributeABC

refreshMetadata()

Update the metadata selection menu.

Performs some additional logic to avoid duplicating decomposition names.

Note that decompositions won't be updated if they have the same name and same metadata headers, if the only things changing are coordinates, or metadata values, the changes should be performed directly on the objects themselves.

Inherited From:
  • EmperorAttributeABC#refreshMetadata
Source:
  • view-controller.js, line 408

resize(width, height)

Resizes the container and the individual elements.

Note, the consumer of this class, likely the main controller should call the resize function any time a resizing event happens.

setMetadataField(m)

Changes the selected value in the metadata menu.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
m String

Metadata column name to control. When the category is null, the metadata selector is set to an empty value, the body grid is emptied, and all the markers are reset to a default state (depends on the subclass).
Inherited From:
  • EmperorAttributeABC#setMetadataField
Source:
  • view-controller.js, line 231
Throws:

Argument m must be a metadata category in one of the decomposition views.

Type
Error
